body:
Since you were currently working on box auth - I wondered if you'd like to look at this one @dbramwell  ?

It should be a question of adding the key straight to the client with `f.rest.SetHeader("Authorization", "Bearer "+f.opt.APIKey)` and disabling the oauth config.

My understanding of rclone is that you support the "lowest common denominator" - i.e. those features that exist on all storage services.

Is it even possible to support this auth mechanism, just for box?
@ncw Sure, I'll take a look. Seem's simple enough, but as always, expect a bunch of questions!
Thank you @dbramwell  and happy to answer questions :-)

Might have jumped the gun a bit here. Between my permissions in Box at work and the Â£8/month cost of adding `App Token` functionality in a personal account, I have no way to create an App Token to test this.

@dbramwell You can get a free account on box. Their entry-level is a free 10GiB account.

Once registered, you go to the "developer" portal and set up the API keys there.

Ah Thanks. Think I was looking at "Admin Console" rather than "Dev Console". Interestingly now that I've created an app in the dev console I can also get into the admin console...

Anyway, I'll have a go at this at some point this week

The thing I don't like about box's dev workflow: all files are uploaded to the dev console and can only be accessed there. So you can't see them in the normal console (was very confusing at first).

So if you upload files and don't understand why they don't show, it's because they're in the dev console.

issue.title: box: allow authentication with access token

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
<!--
Thank you very much for contributing code or documentation to rclone! Please
fill out the following questions to make it easier for us to review your
changes.

You do not need to check all the boxes below all at once, feel free to take
your time and add more commits. If you're done and ready for review, please
check the last box.
-->

#### What is the purpose of this change?

Allow authentication with Box using an access token

#### Was the change discussed in an issue or in the forum before?

[4114](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/issues/4114)

#### Checklist

- [x] I have read the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#submitting-a-pull-request).
- [x] I have added tests for all changes in this PR if appropriate.
- [x] I have added documentation for the changes if appropriate.
- [x] All commit messages are in [house style](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit-messages).
- [x] I'm done, this Pull Request is ready for review :-)

body:
I've put @dbramwell 's change into a branch so it builds a beta for you to try @lonix1 

https://beta.rclone.org/branch/v1.52.0-023-ge11a3e21-fix-4114-box-token-beta/ (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

Thanks for doing this @dbramwell
